Usenet Onboarding (Providers ‚Üí Indexers ‚Üí Automation) ‚Äã

A pragmatic walkthrough for new users: pick a provider, wire an indexer, point Prowlarr/Sonarr/Radarr to SABnzbd, and verify downloads end up in the right folders.

1) Pick a provider (and why it matters) ‚Äã

  • Look for: high retention (4000‚Äì5000+ days), good completion, SSL (563/443), and connection limits that match your automation.
  • Common choices: Newshosting, Eweka, UsenetExpress, Frugal. Consider a backup block account if you hit takedowns.
  • Enter provider creds in SABnzbd (Servers) and enable SSL.

2) Pick an indexer ‚Äã

  • Indexers observe binary groups and publish NZBs. They are separate from providers.
  • Examples: NZBGeek (paid/public), DogNZB/DrunkenSlug (invite). Import into Prowlarr so all Arr apps share one place for indexers.
  • In Prowlarr: add the indexer ‚Üí set API key ‚Üí Sync to Sonarr/Radarr/Whisparr/Lidarr with ‚ÄúSync Level: Full Sync‚Äù.

3) Configure the download client ‚Äã

  • Use SABnzbd (default in this stack). Set host/port/API key in Prowlarr and Arr apps.
  • Paths: set SAB ‚ÄúCompleted Download Folder‚Äù to /downloads/sabnzbd/complete (maps to host downloads path).
  • Enable SSL and set connection count to your provider‚Äôs allowed max.

4) Wire the Arr apps ‚Äã

  • In each Arr app, add your media root: Movies ‚Üí /movies, TV ‚Üí /tv, Music ‚Üí /music, Comics ‚Üí /comics (adjust to your host mapping).
  • Quality/Profiles: pick TRaSH guides or your own; keep them consistent across Arr apps for fewer mismatches. See TRaSH Guides alignment.
  • Connect Download Client: SABnzbd via API key.
  • Connect Indexer: use Prowlarr ‚ÄúSync App‚Äù to push configs automatically.

5) Verify end-to-end ‚Äã

  1. In Sonarr/Radarr, search for a test item ‚Üí should show releases.
  2. Grab ‚Üí Prowlarr hands NZB to SAB ‚Üí SAB downloads to /downloads ‚Üí Arr imports to /tv or /movies.
  3. Check logs if it stalls: SAB history, Arr ‚ÄúActivity‚Äù for import failures, Prowlarr API errors.

6) Folder mappings (this stack) ‚Äã

  • Host downloads: ${DOWNLOADS_ROOT} (example: /var/mnt/fast8tb/Local/downloads).
  • Media roots: ${MEDIA_ROOT}/movies, ${MEDIA_ROOT}/tv (example: /var/mnt/fast8tb/Local/media/<movies|tv>).
  • Books: ${BOOKS_ROOT} (comics/ebooks/audiobooks).
  • Containers see these as /downloads, /movies, /tv, /books, /comics via compose volume mappings.

7) Security & hygiene ‚Äã

  • Always use SSL NNTP ports (563/443). Do not share provider or indexer keys.
  • Respect indexer API limits; keep Prowlarr as the single sync point to avoid duplicating hits.
  • Back up configs: Arr apps, Prowlarr, SABnzbd configs live under your *Config directories on the OneDrive-backed disk.

8) Troubleshooting quick hits ‚Äã

  • ‚ÄúNo releases‚Äù: indexer key wrong, VIP tier required, or categories not mapped ‚Üí re-check Prowlarr ‚Üí Apps mappings.
  • ‚ÄúImport failed‚Äù: path mismatch between SAB and Arr; verify container paths align (/downloads ‚Üî host downloads path).
  • ‚ÄúSlow/failed downloads‚Äù: switch to alternate provider or add block account; verify SSL and connections.

9) Learn more ‚Äã

  • Usenet Primer
  • Usenet (Wikipedia)
  • NZB format
